etymology.description: 釒(金) (jīn, "metal") + 十(十) (shí, "ten") = tool associated with metal -> phonetic borrowing to denote "needle"
etymology.interpretation: The character 針(針) (zhēn, "needle") represents a slender metal tool, with 釒(金) (jīn, "metal") indicating the material and 十(十) (shí, "ten") acting as a phonetic component.
etymology.simplification: 釒(金) was replaced by 钅(金) in the simplified form 针(针), retaining the metal component while simplifying its strokes.

examples.chinese: 妈妈拿针(媽媽拿針)，缝补衣服(縫補衣服)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā ná zhēn, fèng bǔ yīfú.
examples.english: Mother uses a needle to mend clothes.

examples.chinese: 医生用针(醫生用針)，注射药物(注射藥物)。
examples.english: The doctor uses a needle to inject medicine.

examples.chinese: 裁缝用针(裁縫用針)，缝制礼服(縫製禮服)。
examples.pinyin: Cáiféng yòng zhēn, fèng zhì lǐfú.
examples.english: The tailor uses a needle to sew a gown.
